metadata.Title: CVE-2021-23215 on Ubuntu 20.04 ESM (focal) - low.
metadata.Description:
An integer overflow leading to a heap-buffer overflow was found in the DwaCompressor of OpenEXR in versions before 3.0.1. An attacker could use this flaw to crash an application compiled with OpenEXR.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2021-23215` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

libopenexr24 - 2.3.0-6ubuntu0.5+esm1
openexr - 2.3.0-6ubuntu0.5+esm1
Available with Ubuntu Pro: https://ubuntu.com/pro

notes.Note: litios> Patch was also released in v2.5.5

criterions.comment: openexr package in esm-apps/focal was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '2.3.0-6ubuntu0.5+esm1').
